Chris ^ntie and James Fontenette got their averages with 13 and 12 points, respectively, but no one else got more than 6. Poly’s scoring was balanced as usual. Jim Van Winden and Tom Perkins each scored 8 points to lead the Mustangs. Mustangs adjusted well enough to register a 72-60 win behind a balanced scoring attack, led by senior guard Alex l,ambertson with 19 points, Pat Fracisco with 12 and Tom Perkins with 11.
